newsitem.title: NIGERIA: Shell sees good prospects for Nigeria deep water.
newsitem.headline: Shell sees good prospects for Nigeria deep water.

text.p: Early signs from oil exploration in deep waters off Nigeria promise large new crude reserves, senior Shell officials said.
"I think all the operators are very keen," said Shell Nigeria managing director Brian Anderson. "I think there are quite a few good early signs."

Shell plans to start drilling a second exploration well, in block 219, after completing initial drilling in its block 212 Bonga 1 well earlier this year, said Shell Nigeria's general manager for offshore exploration, Femi Lalude.

Exxon Corp, Statoil and Agip and a Statoil/BP -led alliance have also drilled exploration wells in Nigerian waters in depths exceeding 1,000 metres. "It's virgin territory. If we hazard a guess, we'd say there's the potential there for 10 billion barrels," said Lalude.
"But it could turn out to be twice as much or half as much."
Lalude said if reserves proved commercial, Shell was hoping for first oil by 2002-2003, beating the records set for bringing crude onstream in similar depths of water in the Gulf of Mexico.
